snippet: A meeting in Riyadh that lasted more than two hours was said to be cordial but underscored differences over Iran, human rights and the best way to fight terrorism.
abstract: Pres Obama meets with King Salman of Saudi Arabia for over two hours in Riyadh, discussing differences between two countries on issues including Iran, human rights and fight against terrorism; meeting occurs even as Congress is debating bill that would hold Saudi government legally responsible for Sept 11, 2001, attacks if it is proven Saudi officials played role in orchestrating them.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and BEN HUBBARD

lead_paragraph: A meeting in Riyadh that lasted more than two hours was said to be cordial but underscored differences over Iran, human rights and the best way to fight terrorism.

headline.main: Obama and King Salman of Saudi Arabia Meet, but Deep Rifts Remain
headline.print_headline: Obama and Saudi King Meet, but Deep Rifts Remain
